168677103:
We really enjoyed our stay - we brought along our 6 month old bub, and this trip marked our first family holiday together and we made some beautiful memories here. 
For those bringing dogs or children, (or both!) this place is in the perfect location;
* easy walk to a cafe (Oh Dang Espresso Cafe - would highly recommend!) Great value and very friendly staff.
* easy walk a grocery shop and pharmacy (as we all know when you take children anywhere, you always need a trip to the pharmacy!)
* easy walk to a nice little lagoon (great for kids) and also a dog beach down the opposite end of the street, which our Great Dane, Luna, loved. 
What more could one ask for?! Made the trip with a baby and a dog super easy as everything was convenient, local and just flat out lovely! 
For those bringing dogs, Kerri and Alan LOVE dogs. However, please keep in mind, there is no back yard attached to the apartment, and / or gated out door area for your pets (this was an over site by me) This was our only challenge with our stay with our dog, Luna, as she had to stay inside, unless put on a leash and walked or taken to the beach. We had never stayed anywhere with our dog before, but Kerri and Alan made us, Luna and our daughter feel right at home. Simple things, like the muesli, the bath bombs etc were a nice touch. The bathroom was new and a BIG bath - I even got to have a spare 5 minutes to myself to enjoy one - there even cute little candles to lite!
We'd love to come back again as it was just perfect for us :)

25282935:
Lovely, exceptionally clean and brand new townhouse style apartment. Very quiet, did not here the homeowners at all.  
House backs on to well maintained bushland which blocks out some of the ocean wind which is nice- but you can still walk to beach in moments and we didn’t see anyone else there the whole time. Good Location for day trips to berry/Kiama/kangaroo valley but not much in actual Windang - nice lake front and easy walk out to “Windang island” which has great ocean views and again, empty.  Some Shellharbour (and also local) restaurants deliver to Windang which is nice for a Netflix and movie night. There’s a microwave for popcorn too! Plus a large selection of tea and coffee and nice extra provided by homeowners (like bread and butter, cereal, biscuits, milk) 
We Do not recommend getting the local Thai food (thai paradise?) personally- food was tasteless and watery, or “the cantina” in Shellharbour (expensive and not great) but “Oh Dang” cafe down on the main road had exceptional coffee and food- take advantage of their lunch deal (beer, burgers- including vegan option, and chips for $20), great breaky there too and on Friday/Saturday night they have dinner and live music. You can als get take away from there (plastic free!) and go down to the lakefront picnic  tables for a nice lunch outside. Thanks for the nice stay in Windang and for showing us your hard work on Bush regen as well as for accomodating our poochy dog who had the worlds best time chasing balls and swimming for hours on basically our own private beach!

We enjoyed 5 wonderful nights at Kerri & Allan's super clean and relatively new apartment.

Our favourite aspects were the off street parking (close to our entry), bathtub with lovely scented bath bombs, handy kitchenette, and doors on each room enabling us to create a dark sleeping corridor for our two small (very active) dogs who joined us on holiday.

We also loved the selection of teas, chocolate biscuits, and light breakfast provisions. So nice to see the second B appear and to feel you were right at home :) The warm apartment when we first arrived was a nice and welcoming touch (Thanks).

The close proximity to an off leash beach for dogs,  the lake, cafes and with a short drive, many of the local attractions and beaches, made it easy to fill our 5 days with people and dog friendly adventures.

Dining tips: Thai Paradise uses lovely fresh herbs and their meals are tasty and good value. Oh Dang is a nice modern coffee & brunch place within a few minutes walk. There's a list online of pet friendly cafes for the Illawarra area for people visiting the area with their dogs.

Thanks Kerri and Allan for providing a fabulous base for our winter holiday :)

79610465:
Kerri's place "Coast Breeze" was a perfect weekend away from Sydney for my husband and I. The rooms were the cleanest I have ever stayed in - I don't think there was a single speck of dust or a single smudge anywhere.  The rooms consisted of a small living area with a small kitchenette plus a good sized queen bedroom plus a full bathroom with bath and a separate toilet.  All were very new and tastefully decorated.
Although the apartment had its own external private entrance through a lockable sliding door we were surprised when we arrived to find an internal sliding door that would have led to the rest Kerri and Alan's home. This internal door was only a hollow-core door with a flimsy twist-lock and we would have felt more secure and sound-proofed from the main house if this internal door was replaced with a solid-core door.
The location of Coast Breeze is perfect as the beach and inlet to the lake is a very short walk away. A really good Thai restaurant (Thai Garden) is also a short walk away with excellent cafés 5 minutes drive away at Shellharbour. 
A light amount of food was provided (muesli, yogurt, milk, teabags, instant coffee, chocolate, two pieces of bread wrapped in clingwrap and small sachets of butter and vegemite). This could be improved upon with the provision of a full loaf of bread, ground coffee and a plunger and maybe some fruit.
Also the ducted air conditioning was excellent with our own controls. It was so good that we could sleep with the quilt on while it was 23 degrees overnight outside. 
We would happily return to Kerri's place again.
68656916:
A great spot to explore the local beaches, towns and Lake Illawara.  Within walking distance of the Lake, fishing spots, beaches and some local shops.

The property itself is a self- contained one bedroom apartment adjoining, but completely private from, the main house.  It is decorated to a very high standard with excellent air con.  Great shower, bath and beds.  We were a couple, a 3 year old and a our dog.  It suited us just fine, with our daughter sleeping in the sofa bed that easily converts in a less than minute.

The property has it's own terrace which is where we enjoyed a glass of wine once our daughter was asleep.  We also had Thai takeaway from the Thai Garden which was good.

Kerri and Alan were totally respectful of our privacy but one of the highlights was having a lovely chat with them during our stay... The best kind of Air BnB experience!

The off- leash dog beach is beautiful - just the antidote to Sydney's fussy dog regulations!
46916768: Kerris apartment is a beautiful self-sustained place, that is private, clean, and ridiculously comfortable! It has a beautiful modern look to it, without taking from the cosyness of it all. Including an array of other necessities such as shampoo/conditioner etc. There are local shops and take away places nearby that are very useful to have within walking distance. 102698139:
This was our first experience with Airbnb and it was hard to fault.From the enquiry stage to trip completion (and finding we had inadvertently taken one of the teaspoons!) Kerri and Alan were professional, friendly, and helpful. Nothing was too much of a problem.

The unit itself sits at the side/front of the main house, so parking is right at the door. The unit presents as new, with quality finishes and a healthy supply of treats eg chocolate, teas, bath bombs, soaps, dvd's, and so forth.

The bathroom is large with a full size separate bath. The toilet is separate to the bathroom.  The sofa bed has an extra mattress that can be used for those preferring a softer mattress, there was plenty of plush pillows, and most power points were doubles to accommodate technology devotees.  The ducted air conditioning was wonderful, and will soon be controlled independent of the main house. Shutters on the windows and doors were fabulous both visually, and in terms of privacy and soundproofing. Crimsafe screens kept the mossies and monsters out.

Highlights for my dog-mad teen was the passing parade of dogs and owners attending a Christmas party in the host's house on our final night, and the dog-friendly beach within walking distance of the property. Our two small canines were unfortunately too precious to get their feet wet (inland dogs!) but we will persevere when re-visit this gorgeous airbnb property! 

PS The chicken parmi from Pinnocchio's Pizza was amazing ... and delivery only $2!!

Our impeccably furnished and designed studio was spacious enough for the two of us yet cosy enough for the cold nights Towradgi has to offer. It came equipped with our very own pool, garden and beach cabana where we could enjoy sunset drinks at our leisure. It also contained two yoga mats so we could namaste-away all of the wine consumed the night before first thing in he morning.
Raewyn was always available when we had any questions or queries yet kept to themselves and let us do the same - the perfect balance all Air BnB hosts should achieve. 
The house is an easy 10min ($12) uber from the heart of Wollongong where you can enjoy quaint little wine bars and some delicious restaurants. 
Unfortunately (but also fortunately) we have to return to Wollongong as our Skydive was cancelled due to the wind. The fortunate part and silver lining is that we get to enjoy this incredible Air BnB experience all over again. 

Regards

An affordable and cosy guesthouse that is great for value. 

The space: A good amount of space. The space included a couch, bed, kitchenette and bathroom. Everything was kept very clean and with a lovely personality of its own. Noteworthy was the inclusion of a small book collection of classic novels.

The location: The space was about 5 minutes down the road from Wollongong CBD. Highly convenient with access to almost literally anything you needed. 

The hosts: We only managed to chat for a few minutes but Tom and Lisa were both very friendly. They offered to help with anything needed. Their pre-stay communication was prompt and offered detailed instructions on how to get access to the guesthouse (in case they weren’t there). They have two young children who were very well behaved. 

Overall: While the guesthouse is not a luxury stay, it is more than worth its value for its cost. The location is central and the hosts are wonderful. I would recommend this to any person/couple (up to maybe 3 people) looking to stay in or getting to know the Wollongong area, and am looking forward to staying there again if I am in the area.

Thanks again for the great stay.
8406927: On our arrival we were welcomed by friendly hosts Mark and Kelly and introduced to their lovely compact cabin, situated in their quiet garden between majestic trees. The cabin was stylishly decorated and equipped with all the necessities; microwave oven, kettle, toaster, fridge, heater and a very comfortable queen size bed. The colourful crockery complemented the bright and airy interior of this charming cabin. Together with tea, coffee and milk, our thoughtful hosts also supplied salt and pepper. Shampoo and shower gel were place in the luxurious walk-in shower. A deck with a little table and two chairs made afternoon tea a real picnic. My husband and I would definitely like to visit again!
169160065: Small cabin behind the main house which is across from a park and school ground. Fair number of steps to get past the main house and up to it. Mark and Kelly insisted on carrying our suitcases. Full kitchen but no proper eating area inside. Deck outside with picnic table and barbecue.
221095074: The landlord is very nice and the house is perfect for a holiday!
25279134: Kelly and Mark have a sweet, well decorated cottage behind their house. Sparkling clean and well maintained with an amazing shower included. A caution to those who have mobility issues; the cottage is at the top of a very steep path of stairs which does not have handrails etc., so if you have some luggage you may not be able to make it up.
222766557:
A lovely wee cabin at the top of Kelly And Mark’s garden. Kelly and Mark were so accommodating and let us use their washer/drier which was so helpful as we were between multi-day hikes so our clothes needed washed!

There was a small carton of milk in the fridge which meant we could make ourselves some tea (not like a little pot thing where you get half a cup of tea and run out!) and also some fruit and a couple of wee chocolates :):) there was a microwave and a kettle next to a big sink. Also plates/bowls/cutlery/mugs/tea/coffee/washing up liquid. Everything you could need.

Towels were provided and even beach towels were in the room for if we had time to make it to the beach (we didn’t because a storm hit unfortunately!)

The shower is huuuuge and a total luxury to use! The toilet is not directly off the room so you have to nip outside to the next door (like 1 step to the left) so really not a big deal. There is windows on 3 sides of the cabin so it’s really light and all have good roller blinds on them for privacy and keeps the sun out well.

There are screens on the windows if you want to open them without insects getting in, additionally there is a really effective air conditioner which cools the room in a matter of 2 or 3 minutes.

10 out of 10, would absolutely stay again!

The cabin itself was perfect for our stay. It is clean and spacious and contained everything we needed (we cooked most nights at the cabin). The decking is a fantastic space (and pretty unique when compared to other local short term lets) and we enjoyed many evenings sitting out there. The location is within walking distance to several shops, supermarkets, restaurants and cafes and has good bus links into the town and to local beaches (we didn’t have a car but found it very easy to get around the area). The area is very quiet and peaceful and makes a nice change from the busy city. 

We highly recommend this Airbnb for both long and short term stays. It was a perfect place for us and we were very sad to leave!

I would highly recommend this listing and thank Gerry for his obvious generosity and care.

51105317:
Rekah and Das are fantastic hosts, they made my family feel most welcome and made our entire stay very comfortable and enjoyable.  The location of Northpoint Apartments is perfect for a relaxing and entertaining stay in Wollongong.  The apartment itself is perfect for families and is located close to North Wollongong surf beach and all this area has to offer. 
The apartment was very clean on arrival and had all the conveniences that we needed. The entire unit was very comfortable it is quite large with great living spaces and an outdoor area to enjoy a morning breakfast or afternoon cup of tea. The beds were very comfortable, the unit complex is very quiet and we all slept really well.  The kitchen had everything we needed and we cooked a few meals which certainly saves a bit from having to eat out all the time. There was also a secure garage located on the basement/ground level of the complex for our car.  
Communication with Rekah and Das was excellent and we knew what we needed to bring with us. If we needed anything or had a query Rekah and Das were only a phone call away and although we didn't need to contact them that often it was reassuring to know that they lived on site and were able to help. They even offered to give us a lift to the wedding reception we were in Wollongong for!! Great Hosts!!   
The location of the unit is great, walking distance to just about everything.  The North Wollongong surf beach which is nearby, is patrolled and makes swimming very safe. The walks along the waterfront were terrific and we certainly made the most of the lovely weather to enjoy this area.  Being close to restaurants and cafes enabled us to have a coffee after our walks and have the occasional breakfast or dinner out. The North Wollongong Railway station is a short walk from the unit and we also enjoyed a nice day trip to Sydney. It meant we didn't need to find a carpark or have concerns about leaving our car in the street. Supermarkets and shopping centres are only a short drive  or bus ride away. Local bus stops are located near the unit and Wollongong has a good transit system with a free city circuit bus routes which will take you to most areas you need.  We had our own car which enabled us to visit family while in Wollongong and also explore some of the local areas of interest including the Sea Cliff bridge, the Illawarra Fly and other local beaches in the area.
Finally I would like to highly recommend Northpoint Apartments to anyone, Rekah and Das are fantastic hosts and the apartment is first class in all respects. You'll enjoy your stay here and the description and photo gives you a very honest description of what you can expect. We would certainly like to stay here again when we visit our family in Wollongong. 5 Stars.

The apartment was spacious and clean. The common bathroom and shower was small. There was an on-suite with shower in one of the bedrooms however it was only covered by a curtain. The 4 single beds, 2 in each room were adequate however small and not what we are used to at home. The lounge/dining room was large and comfortable. The kitchen was adequate with a dishwasher, although the dishwasher was not secured properly and tilted forward when you opened the door. The kitchen could have used more cutlery and dishes. There was a washer and dryer in the apartment although we had to look up online to see how it worked. The clothes seemed to take a long time to wash. 这是一个非常美的房子!Avril对于房屋的装修有很好的品味,如其他房客提到的,浴室的淋浴设施及浴缸让人惊喜!!
我们选择的房间由于是两个人带着大行李箱所以显得有一点点拥挤,但并不影响短途居住,房间舒适整洁且温暖,令人非常满意!
入住也非常方便,赶上雨天到达的时间比较晚,但房屋是电子锁所以可以自助｡地理位置处于安静的居民区,周围有免费巴士,几家快餐店,距离大学也不远｡
强烈推荐Avril的房子给到访卧龙岗的访客!如果有机会我们还会再选择这里!
62643479: 일층에 세 방이 에어비엔비에요. 모르고 저희만 있는줄 알고 갔는데 다른 게스트들도 있더라구요. 저희가 묵은 방은 작지만 전체적으로 깨끗하고 샤워실이 크고 화장실이 정말 좋아요. 뒷마당은 충분히 넓고 부엌에는 조미료나 기타 필요한 주방용품이 다 구비되어 있어서 편하게 요리할 수 있었습니다. , 위치도 north wollongong 역에서 멀지 않고 건너편에 아웃백, 맥도날드, 피자헛, 편의점 등이 있어요. 가격대비 추천합니다~
